channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We are acquaintances, not friends’: My neighbors need somewhere to stay after a house fire. Do I say yes?
item.description: “We feel obliged to offer our house to this couple to live in while they deal with this horrible experience.”

item.title: This is not a good time to have a bad credit score
item.description: FICO says it will introduce buy-now-pay-later loan data into its credit-scoring models.

item.title: My grandmother disinherited my father, yet made him executor of her will. Now he refuses to file for probate.
item.description: “When my grandfather died, my father went into their home and took financial information and jewelry.”

item.title: China is about to shock the U.S. economy again. Economists who predicted the first offer a plan to fight back.
item.description: Two economics professors say the U.S. is facing another big shock from China, and it could be worse than the first. They have a survival plan.

item.title: Sports Illustrated swimsuit model Olivia Dunne says NYC co-op rejected her after bid for Babe Ruth’s old apartment
item.description: Star gymnast and TikTok sensation Olivia Dunne says she was rejected by a New York co-op board after putting in an all-cash offer on a $1.6M apartment...

item.title: AI text-to-speech programs could “unlearn” how to imitate certain people
item.description: A technique known as “machine unlearning” could teach AI models to forget specific voices—an important step in stopping the rise of audio deepfakes, w...

item.title: AI’s giants want to take over the classroom
item.description: School’s out and it’s high summer, but a bunch of teachers are plotting how they’re going to use AI this upcoming school year. God help them. On July ...

item.title: The Download: California’s AI power plans, and and why it’s so hard to make welfare AI fair

item.title: AI’s fourth wave is here — are enterprises ready for what’s next?
item.description: To maintain competitive advantage through the next five years, which innovations must forward-thinking companies prioritize right now?

item.title: Zimmer Biomet to acquire Monogram Technologies for $177M
item.description: Zimmer Biomet said the Monogram acquisition will contribute to revenue growth in 2027 and boost its robotic knee adoption in the U.S. The post Zimmer ...

item.title: MOTOR Ai gets seed funding toward explainable self-driving software
item.description: MOTOR Ai is scaling its Level 4 autonomous driving software to be deployed in German public transport this year. The post MOTOR Ai gets seed funding t...

item.title: Global industrial robot market contracted 5.8% last year, reports Interact Analysis
item.description: Industrial robot demand and output will continue to rise in Asia-Pacific, but Europe is lagging, noted Interact Analysis. The post Global industrial r...

item.title: Amazon launches Kiro, its own Claude-powered challenger to Windsurf and Codex
item.description: Initial community reactions to Kiro were mixed, but developers were intrigued, praising the emphasis on specs, hooks and structure.

item.title: Liquid AI releases on-device foundation model LFM2
item.description: Liquid AI said the performance gains it made with LFM2 make it the ideal choice for local and edge use cases. The post Liquid AI releases on-device fo...

item.title: Remaining Windsurf team and tech acquired by Cognition, makers of Devin: ‘We’re friends with Anthropic again’
item.description: Cognition CEO Scott Wu and interim Windsurf CEO Jeff Wang said they would start by integrating the AI-powered engineer Devin into Windsurf.

item.title: California is set to become the first US state to manage power outages with AI
item.description: California’s statewide power grid operator is poised to become the first in North America to deploy artificial intelligence to manage outages, MIT Tec...

item.title: The human harbor: Navigating identity and meaning in the AI age
item.description: The future is marked by deepening uncertainty about our place in it, and by growing ambiguity about the nature of human purpose itself.

item.title: Pharm Robotics advances automated dairy cow healthcare
item.description: Pharm Robotics' Sureshot automates cow vaccinations and treatments with robotics, 3D vision, and AI for optimal dairy herd health. The post Pharm Robo...

item.title: Stop vetting engineers like it’s 2021 — the AI-native workforce has arrived
item.description: Jobs will fade and rise due to AI. But those who learn to screen, train and build dev teams around AI-enabled talent will write the future.
